title: CEFR-Based Formative Assessment Design Program for Elementary English Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: An online-offline integrated classroom environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops), operating a platform capable of providing personalized feedback to learners

learning_goals: Learners can perform CEFR Basic User (A1â€“A2) level tasks for the four core communication functions (reception, production, interaction, mediation) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can write self-reflection reports and create personalized learning plans based on weekly formative assessment results.
Teachers apply three differentiated instructional strategies based on learner types (low-growth/assimilation-centered/high-growth) using K-means clustering analysis results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
